I am about to attach the example files, but the key point is that if you hand 
off to style an XML file with a DTD that cant be be found the build continues 
and a zero byte lenght output file is left.

[style] : Fatal Error! org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: 
File "nap:chemical+brothers" not found. Cause: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: 
File "nap:chemical+brothers" not found.

BUILD SUCCESSFUL
Total time: 5 seconds

This may be a Xalan problem; I will download a new version and test, but am 
filing this away first so even if that does fix it, we have something in 
bugzilla.

text:
I don't know what is causing the problem but don't forget that it is not always 
possible to validate against a dtd (for example your xml could point to an 
external url and you are offline and you don't have a resolver that uses a 
local copy) or you simply don't have the local copy.

If you are offline and  don't have a custom resolver that backoff to a local 
copy your alternative is to modify the dtd.

I think there was a discussion to allow parsing without dtd resolving (or at 
least external) but I believe it could be problematic for entities defined in 
the dtd...

The problem here is that I expected the task to fail if the DTD couldnt be 
resolved, but it isnt. the task isnt finishing (correct behavior), but it isnt 
being caught by <style>, and there is the problem of the zero byte output file 
being created which stops style running next time.

<jspc> had this same problem with jasper BTW; no it checks for the dest file 
being empty and marks it as out of date in this case, and cleans up leftover 
java files afterwards. crufty but necessary
